relation: Great for these types of students
Parking is always friendly. There is security in the building at all times. And a police officer on campus.
Great for any type of student. Single mother, grandmother, high school graduate, etc.
It is a wonderful place. I wish that they were able to offer bachelor's degrees so i could fulfill my educational goals.

There is so much that PPCC offers if you need help with your homework or lesson plan. There is a math lab that is just directed towards math and there is professors in there at all times to help you. There is tutors or you can get together with classmates and have a study party.
It is always very clean and very well taken care of.
I feel like I am getting a wonderful education. There is so much that PPCC offers.
My tips for prospective students would be to always be on time. Always know your priorities to get your work done, study, and attend class. Really analyze what the professors are educating you on.

Pikes Peak Community College is an amazing place to go to further your education. It is very diverse and doesn't matter where you came from, your past, your age or any of that. I am looking forward to achieving my goals at PPCC
pageTitle: Pikes Peak Community College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {358235=Well I haven't attended the school yet, I've only signed up for my classes I'll be attending in the spring of 2015. So it's difficult for me to speak upon the academic rigor at this moment., 367302=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 253549=I attend PPCC from 2012-2013 but, unfortunately I had to move out of state. I love PPCC because of the degree plan I had set up and the staff. The staff members there try to work with you and help as much as they can, also the class sizes are perfect not to big and not to small., 268265=Will start classes August 2013 but so far has been great, 1742=The tuition of Pikes Peak is a decent price and financial aid really helps too. For my last semester which was 14 credit hours I paid 1600 plus books.}
textBeforeTable: 12/26/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 5 out of 5 people found this review useful. 1 of 97 Whitney from Woodland Park, CO Check out reviews left by other students or leave your own review. textAfterTable: Clubs and Activities there are limited numbers of clubs and activities at pikes peak. Great for these types of students students who want one-on-one help from the teacher and great interaction between fellow students. Bang for the buck with in-state tuition at less than $3500, earning a two year degree cannot be cheaper. What to do for fun find a study group. this is a great way to meet new people and get help outside the classroom. Food and Dining the cafeteria is good, healthy food at a good price. Dorm Life pikes peak does not have dorms. Academic Rigor since this is a community college, this is not the most competitive learning environment. it is college, so not a place to be lazy either. Tips for prospective students always be on time to classes and listen to what the teachers say. if it sounds important, write it down! In three sentences
